snippet: A classified review concluded that many past attempts by the agency to arm foreign forces covertly had a minimal impact on the long-term outcome of a conflict.
abstract: Central Intelligence Agency internal study finds that many past attempts by agency to arm foreign forces covertly had minimal impact on long-term outcome of a conflict; review shows that such efforts were even less effective when militias fought without any direct American support on the ground; findings lead to deep skepticism among Obama administration officials about wisdom of arming and training members of fractured Syrian opposition.
lead_paragraph: A classified review concluded that many past attempts by the agency to arm foreign forces covertly had a minimal impact on the long-term outcome of a conflict.

headline.main: C.I.A. Study of Covert Aid Fueled Skepticism About Helping Syrian Rebels
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Study Says Arming Rebels Seldom Works

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
